verb.description: (of a person) thrust a knife or other pointed weapon into (someone) so as to wound or kill.
examples: he stabbed him in the stomach
the fatal stabbings of four rival gang members

noun.description: A thrust with a knife or other pointed weapon.

examples: Meredith made a feeble stab at joining in

phrases: Outsourcing jobs overseas is a stab in the back to all the workers who have made this country what it is.
Many said it was a stab in the back for our region.
But the party has no tradition of back-stabbing its leaders: on the contrary, it has been very forbearing of them, even when a stab in the back might have been in everyone's interest.
This is a stab in the back and the last thing they need.
They knew only that it was a rich Spartan colony; capturing it would be a stab in the back of their enemy, bringing the long Peloponnesian War to a quick, triumphal end.
origin: Late Middle English: of unknown origin.
